text: Benjamin Kogo (30 November 1944 â€“ 20 January 2022) was a Kenyan athlete. His main sport was 3000 metre steeplechase running. He won a silver medal at the 1968 Summer Olympics. He won gold at the first All-Africa Games held in 1965 in Brazzaville. Kogo was born in Arwos, Nandi District. He died from prostate cancer on January 20, 2022 at the age of 77.Olympic medalist Ben Kogo is dead ==References== Category:1945 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Kenyan athletes Category:Olympic medalists for Kenya Category:Olympic silver medalists Category:Deaths from prostate cancer
title: Benjamin Kogo
